kaninator.game
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.game.GameState
      kaninator.game.Game

public class Game
extends GameState

The game state. The actual game is played in this state. The game loop resides here.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
GameState

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(Camera _camera,
            GUI _gui,
            Keyboard _keyboard,
            Mouse _mouse,
            Canvas _canvas,
            java.lang.String mapPath)
     throws GameException
Initializes the game. Loads the map using MapLoader, creates animations for the player and the zombies using AnimationFactory and positions them randomly.

Parameters:
_camera - The camera class used to render the internal objects to a 2 dimensional screen.
_gui - The gui class used for overlays.
_keyboard - The keyboard class for key input.
_mouse - Mouse input.
Throws:
GameException
See Also:
AnimationFactory, MapLoader
Method Detail

getScore

public int getScore()
Gets the score the player has managed to achieve. Should be called after the game is over.

Returns:
The score the player has achieved in the current game.

doState

public int doState()
The game loop. Sends the DynamicObjects (Player & NonPlayerObjects) to the camera, enters the game loop (update objects -> update camera -> update player -> change the player coordinates -> loop). After the game loop is done it clears up the objects from the camera. Returns to the main menu if the player cancels the game, otherwise the high score menu.

Specified by:
doState in class GameState
Returns:
The index to the next state to be performed.

spawnZombies

private void spawnZombies()
Has a ZOMBIE_SPAWN_PROBABILITY chance to spawn a random amount of Zombies at random positions on the map. The amount of Zombies can never exceed MAX_ZOMBIES.

movePlayer

private void movePlayer()
Passes the keyboard input to the player.
